sinaiticus.text: And again, the prophet says, The Spirit of Yahweh is upon me, because he has anointed me to preach the gospel unto the poor, he has sent me to heal those that are broken in heart, to preach deliverance to the captives, and the recovery of sight to482 the blind, to tell of the acceptable year of Yahweh, and the day of recompense, to comfort all that mourn.

verses.text: And again, the prophet says, The Spirit of Yahweh is upon me, because he has anointed me to preach the gospel unto the poor, he has sent me to heal those that are broken in heart, to preach deliverance to the captives, and the recovery of sight to482 the blind, to tell of the acceptable year of Yahweh, and the day of recompense, to comfort all that mourn.

sinaiticus.text: And, moreover, concerning the Shabbat it is written in the Ten Commandments, in which he spoke on Mount Sinai unto Moshe face to face: Sanctify you the Shabbat of Yahweh with pure hands and a pure heart.

verses.text: And, moreover, concerning the Shabbat it is written in the Ten Commandments, in which he spoke on Mount Sinai unto Moshe face to face: Sanctify you the Shabbat of Yahweh with pure hands and a pure heart.

sinaiticus.text: And in another place he says, If My sons shall keep My Shabbat, then will I place My mercy upon them.

verses.text: And in another place he says, If My sons shall keep My Shabbat, then will I place My mercy upon them.

sinaiticus.text: He speaks, too, of the Shabbat in the beginning of the creation: And Elohim made in six days the works of his hands, and finished them on the seventh day, and rested in it and sanctified it.

verses.text: He speaks, too, of the Shabbat in the beginning of the creation: And Elohim made in six days the works of his hands, and finished them on the seventh day, and rested in it and sanctified it.

sinaiticus.text: Consider, my children, what signify the words, He finished them in six days. They mean this: that in six thousand years Yahweh will make an end of all things, for a day is with him as a thousand years. And he himself bears witness unto me, saying: Behold this day a day shall be as a thousand years. Therefore, my children, in six days, that is in six thousand years, shall all things be brought to an end.

verses.text: Consider, my children, what signify the words, He finished them in six days. They mean this: that in six thousand years Yahweh will make an end of all things, for a day is with him as a thousand years. And he himself bears witness unto me, saying: Behold this day a day shall be as a thousand years. Therefore, my children, in six days, that is in six thousand years, shall all things be brought to an end.

sinaiticus.text: And the words, He rested on the seventh day, signify this: After that his Son has come, and has caused to cease the time of the wicked one, and has judged the unrighteous, and changed the sun and the moon and the stars, then shall he rest well on the seventh day.

verses.text: And the words, He rested on the seventh day, signify this: After that his Son has come, and has caused to cease the time of the wicked one, and has judged the unrighteous, and changed the sun and the moon and the stars, then shall he rest well on the seventh day.

sinaiticus.text: And further he says, you shall sanctify it with pure hands and a pure heart. Who, therefore, can sanctify the day which Yahweh has sanctified, unless he be pure of heart? in all things have we been deceived.

verses.text: And further he says, you shall sanctify it with pure hands and a pure heart. Who, therefore, can sanctify the day which Yahweh has sanctified, unless he be pure of heart? in all things have we been deceived.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, that then indeed we shall be able to rest well and sanctify; even when we ourselves, having been justified, and having received the promise, when iniquity exists no longer, but all things have been made new by Yahweh, we shall then be able to sanctify it, having been first sanctified ourselves.

verses.text: Behold, that then indeed we shall be able to rest well and sanctify; even when we ourselves, having been justified, and having received the promise, when iniquity exists no longer, but all things have been made new by Yahweh, we shall then be able to sanctify it, having been first sanctified ourselves.

sinaiticus.text: And, further, he says unto them, Your new moons and your Shabbatot I cannot endure. See, now, what He means. The Shabbatot that now are, are not acceptable unto Me, but that which I have made is, even that in which, after that I have brought all things to an end, I shall make a beginning of the

verses.text: And, further, he says unto them, Your new moons and your Shabbatot I cannot endure. See, now, what He means. The Shabbatot that now are, are not acceptable unto Me, but that which I have made is, even that in which, after that I have brought all things to an end, I shall make a beginning of the

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore we also keep the eighth day as a day of gladness, on which also we learned that Yahshua was risen from the dead, and after he had appeared ascended unto heaven.

verses.text: Wherefore we also keep the eighth day as a day of gladness, on which also we learned that Yahshua was risen from the dead, and after he had appeared ascended unto heaven.

sinaiticus.text: And I will, moreover, tell you concerning the temple, how these wretched men, being deceived, placed their hopes in the building as if it were the habitation of Elohim, and not on the Elohim who has made them.

verses.text: And I will, moreover, tell you concerning the temple, how these wretched men, being deceived, placed their hopes in the building as if it were the habitation of Elohim, and not on the Elohim who has made them.

sinaiticus.text: For almost after the manner of the Gentiles did they consecrate Him in the temple. But what says Yahweh, making it of no effect? Hearken you: Who has measured out the heaven with his palm, or the earth with the flat of his hand, is it not I? says Yahweh. Heaven is My throne, and earth the footstool of My feet. What house will you build for Me, or what shall be the place of My rest? You have known that their hope was vain.

verses.text: For almost after the manner of the Gentiles did they consecrate Him in the temple. But what says Yahweh, making it of no effect? Hearken you: Who has measured out the heaven with his palm, or the earth with the flat of his hand, is it not I? says Yahweh. Heaven is My throne, and earth the footstool of My feet. What house will you build for Me, or what shall be the place of My rest? You have known that their hope was vain.

sinaiticus.text: And, yet further, He says again, Behold those who have destroyed this temple shall rebuild it.

verses.text: And, yet further, He says again, Behold those who have destroyed this temple shall rebuild it.

sinaiticus.text: And so is it done, for through their war it has been destroyed by the enemy, and now both they themselves and the servants of their enemies shall rebuild it.

verses.text: And so is it done, for through their war it has been destroyed by the enemy, and now both they themselves and the servants of their enemies shall rebuild it.

sinaiticus.text: And again it was made manifest how the temple and the people of Israel should be given up to their enemies. For the scripture says, And it shall come to pass in the last days that Yahweh shall deliver up the sheep of his pasture, and their fold and their tower shall he give up to destruction; and it was done according to that which Yahweh had spoken.

verses.text: And again it was made manifest how the temple and the people of Israel should be given up to their enemies. For the scripture says, And it shall come to pass in the last days that Yahweh shall deliver up the sheep of his pasture, and their fold and their tower shall he give up to destruction; and it was done according to that which Yahweh had spoken.

sinaiticus.text: Let us inquire, therefore, whether there be any temple of Yahweh. There is; even where he himself has declared that he would make and perfect it. For it is written, And it shall be when the week is completed that the temple of Yahweh shall be built gloriously in the name of Yahweh.

verses.text: Let us inquire, therefore, whether there be any temple of Yahweh. There is; even where he himself has declared that he would make and perfect it. For it is written, And it shall be when the week is completed that the temple of Yahweh shall be built gloriously in the name of Yahweh.

sinaiticus.text: I find, therefore, that there is a temple; how then shall it be built in the name of Yahweh? Learn you. Before that we believed in Elohim the habitation of our heart was corrupt and feeble, as being of a truth a temple built by hands. For it was full of idolatry, and was a habitation of demons, because we did such things as were contrary to Elohim;

verses.text: I find, therefore, that there is a temple; how then shall it be built in the name of Yahweh? Learn you. Before that we believed in Elohim the habitation of our heart was corrupt and feeble, as being of a truth a temple built by hands. For it was full of idolatry, and was a habitation of demons, because we did such things as were contrary to Elohim;

sinaiticus.text: But it shall be built in the name of Yahweh. Attend you: that the temple of Yahweh may be built gloriously. But in what484 manner? Learn you: having received the remission of our sins, and having hoped upon the name of Yahweh, we have become new, having been again created entirely. Wherefore Elohim of a truth dwells in us as in an habitation.

verses.text: But it shall be built in the name of Yahweh. Attend you: that the temple of Yahweh may be built gloriously. But in what484 manner? Learn you: having received the remission of our sins, and having hoped upon the name of Yahweh, we have become new, having been again created entirely. Wherefore Elohim of a truth dwells in us as in an habitation.

sinaiticus.text: How? The word of his faith, the calling of his promise, the wisdom of his ordinances, the commandments of his doctrine, he himself prophesying in us, he himself dwelling in us. To us, who were enslaved by death, he opens the gate of the temple, which is his mouth, and, giving us repentance, leads us into the temple incorruptible.

verses.text: How? The word of his faith, the calling of his promise, the wisdom of his ordinances, the commandments of his doctrine, he himself prophesying in us, he himself dwelling in us. To us, who were enslaved by death, he opens the gate of the temple, which is his mouth, and, giving us repentance, leads us into the temple incorruptible.

sinaiticus.text: For he who desires to be saved looks not unto the man, but unto him that dwells in him and speaks in him, wondering that he had never before heard him speaking such words out of his mouth, or even desired to hear. This is the spiritual temple built by Yahweh.

verses.text: For he who desires to be saved looks not unto the man, but unto him that dwells in him and speaks in him, wondering that he had never before heard him speaking such words out of his mouth, or even desired to hear. This is the spiritual temple built by Yahweh.

sinaiticus.text: So far as it is possible for me to show you these things with simplicity, my mind and spirit hopes that I have not omitted any of the things that pertain unto salvation;

verses.text: So far as it is possible for me to show you these things with simplicity, my mind and spirit hopes that I have not omitted any of the things that pertain unto salvation;

sinaiticus.text: For if I write unto you concerning the things that are at hand, or the things that will be hereafter, you would not be able to understand them, because they are couched in parables. These things, therefore, are thus.

verses.text: For if I write unto you concerning the things that are at hand, or the things that will be hereafter, you would not be able to understand them, because they are couched in parables. These things, therefore, are thus.

sinaiticus.text: Let us pass on now to another kind of knowledge and instruction. There are two paths of instruction and authority – the one that of light, and the other that of darkness. But there is a great difference between the two paths. For over the one are appointed as illuminators the angels of Elohim, over the other the angels of Satan;

verses.text: Let us pass on now to another kind of knowledge and instruction. There are two paths of instruction and authority – the one that of light, and the other that of darkness. But there is a great difference between the two paths. For over the one are appointed as illuminators the angels of Elohim, over the other the angels of Satan;

sinaiticus.text: On the one side is he who is Yahweh from everlasting to everlasting, on the other is the ruler of the world that now lies in wickedness.

verses.text: On the one side is he who is Yahweh from everlasting to everlasting, on the other is the ruler of the world that now lies in wickedness.

sinaiticus.text: Now, the path of life is this: If any one wishes to travel to the appointed place, let him hasten by means of his works. Now, the knowledge of walking in it that is given unto us is of this

verses.text: Now, the path of life is this: If any one wishes to travel to the appointed place, let him hasten by means of his works. Now, the knowledge of walking in it that is given unto us is of this

sinaiticus.text: You shall love him that made you, you shall fear him that formed you, you shall glorify him that redeemed you from death. You shall be simple in heart, and rich in spirit; you shall not cleave unto those who go in the path of death. You shall hate whatever is not pleasing unto Elohim; you shall hate all hypocrisy; you shall not abandon the commandments of Yahweh;

verses.text: You shall love him that made you, you shall fear him that formed you, you shall glorify him that redeemed you from death. You shall be simple in heart, and rich in spirit; you shall not cleave unto those who go in the path of death. You shall hate whatever is not pleasing unto Elohim; you shall hate all hypocrisy; you shall not abandon the commandments of Yahweh;

sinaiticus.text: You shall not exalt yourself; you shall be humble in all things; you shall not take glory unto yourself; you shall not take evil counsel against your neighbour; you shall not take audacity into your spirit.

verses.text: You shall not exalt yourself; you shall be humble in all things; you shall not take glory unto yourself; you shall not take evil counsel against your neighbour; you shall not take audacity into your spirit.

sinaiticus.text: You shall not commit fornication, you shall not commit adultery. You shall not pollute yourself with mankind: let not the word of Elohim go forth from you in corruption. You shall not accept the person of any to reprove any man for transgression. You shall be gentle, you shall be quiet; you shall tremble at the words that you have heard; you shall not bear malice against your brother;

verses.text: You shall not commit fornication, you shall not commit adultery. You shall not pollute yourself with mankind: let not the word of Elohim go forth from you in corruption. You shall not accept the person of any to reprove any man for transgression. You shall be gentle, you shall be quiet; you shall tremble at the words that you have heard; you shall not bear malice against your brother;

sinaiticus.text: You shall not doubt whether a thing shall be or not; you shall not take the name of Yahweh in vain. You shall love your neighbor beyond your own spirit; you shall not kill a child by abortion, neither shall you destroy it after it is born. You shall not remove your hand from your son or your daughter, but shalt teach them from their youth the fear of Yahweh.

verses.text: You shall not doubt whether a thing shall be or not; you shall not take the name of Yahweh in vain. You shall love your neighbor beyond your own spirit; you shall not kill a child by abortion, neither shall you destroy it after it is born. You shall not remove your hand from your son or your daughter, but shalt teach them from their youth the fear of Yahweh.

sinaiticus.text: You shall not covet your neighbor’s goods; you shall not be an extortioner; you shall not cleave with your spirit unto the proud, but you shall have your behavior with the lowly and the just. Receive as blessings the troubles that come unto you, knowing that without Elohim nothing is done.

verses.text: You shall not covet your neighbor’s goods; you shall not be an extortioner; you shall not cleave with your spirit unto the proud, but you shall have your behavior with the lowly and the just. Receive as blessings the troubles that come unto you, knowing that without Elohim nothing is done.

sinaiticus.text: You shall not be double-minded nor double-tongued, for to be double-tongued is the snare of death. You shall submit yourself to your masters as to the image of Elohim, with shame and fear. You shall not give commands with bitterness to your servant and your handmaid, who hope in the same Elohim as you do, lest, perchance, you cease to fear Elohim, who is over both. For he came not to call men with respect of persons, but to call those whom the Spirit had prepared.

verses.text: You shall not be double-minded nor double-tongued, for to be double-tongued is the snare of death. You shall submit yourself to your masters as to the image of Elohim, with shame and fear. You shall not give commands with bitterness to your servant and your handmaid, who hope in the same Elohim as you do, lest, perchance, you cease to fear Elohim, who is over both. For he came not to call men with respect of persons, but to call those whom the Spirit had prepared.

sinaiticus.text: You shall communicate in all things with your neighbour, and shalt not say that things are thine own. For if you be partners in that which is incorruptible, how much more in the things that are corruptible? You shall not be hasty of speech,486 for the mouth is a snare of death. As far as you are able, you shall be pure concerning your spirit.

verses.text: You shall communicate in all things with your neighbour, and shalt not say that things are thine own. For if you be partners in that which is incorruptible, how much more in the things that are corruptible? You shall not be hasty of speech,486 for the mouth is a snare of death. As far as you are able, you shall be pure concerning your spirit.

sinaiticus.text: Be not a stretcher forth of your hand in receiving, and a drawer back of it in giving. You shall love, as the apple of thine eye, every one that speaks unto you the word of Yahweh.

verses.text: Be not a stretcher forth of your hand in receiving, and a drawer back of it in giving. You shall love, as the apple of thine eye, every one that speaks unto you the word of Yahweh.

sinaiticus.text: You shall remember the Day of Judgment by night and by day; and you shall seek out every day the persons of the saints.

verses.text: You shall remember the Day of Judgment by night and by day; and you shall seek out every day the persons of the saints.

sinaiticus.text: You shall not doubt to give, nor shall you murmur in giving. Give to every one that asks you, and you shall know who is the good recompenser of the reward. You shall take care of that which you have received, neither adding thereto, nor taking therefrom. You shall hate the evil man unto the end, and shalt judge justly.

verses.text: You shall not doubt to give, nor shall you murmur in giving. Give to every one that asks you, and you shall know who is the good recompenser of the reward. You shall take care of that which you have received, neither adding thereto, nor taking therefrom. You shall hate the evil man unto the end, and shalt judge justly.

sinaiticus.text: You shall not make a schism, but shalt make peace by bringing adversaries together. You shall make confession of your sins. You shall not go unto prayer with an evil conscience. This is the way of life, either labouring by means of the word and proceeding to exhort, and practicing to save the spirit by the word, or you shall work by your hands for the redemption of your sins.

verses.text: You shall not make a schism, but shalt make peace by bringing adversaries together. You shall make confession of your sins. You shall not go unto prayer with an evil conscience. This is the way of life, either labouring by means of the word and proceeding to exhort, and practicing to save the spirit by the word, or you shall work by your hands for the redemption of your sins.

sinaiticus.text: But the path of darkness is crooked and full of cursing, for it is the path of eternal death and punishment, in which way are the things that destroy the spirit. Idolatry, boldness, the pride of power, hypocrisy, double-heartedness, adultery, murder, rape, haughtiness, transgression, deceit, malice, self-will, witchcraft, sorcery, covetousness, want of the fear of Elohim.

verses.text: But the path of darkness is crooked and full of cursing, for it is the path of eternal death and punishment, in which way are the things that destroy the spirit. Idolatry, boldness, the pride of power, hypocrisy, double-heartedness, adultery, murder, rape, haughtiness, transgression, deceit, malice, self-will, witchcraft, sorcery, covetousness, want of the fear of Elohim.

sinaiticus.text: Here are those who are persecutors of the good, haters of truth, lovers of lies; those who know not the reward of righteousness, who cleave not to what is good nor unto just judgment; who attend not to the widow and the orphan; who are awake not unto the fear of Elohim, but unto evil; from whom meekness and patience are afar off; who love the things that are vain, who follow after recompense, who pity not the poor, who labour not for him who is in trouble; who are prompt to evil-speaking, who know not him that made them; murderers of children, corruptors of the image of Elohim; who turn away from the poor man and oppress the afflicted; advocates of the rich, unjust judges of the poor, sinners in all

verses.text: Here are those who are persecutors of the good, haters of truth, lovers of lies; those who know not the reward of righteousness, who cleave not to what is good nor unto just judgment; who attend not to the widow and the orphan; who are awake not unto the fear of Elohim, but unto evil; from whom meekness and patience are afar off; who love the things that are vain, who follow after recompense, who pity not the poor, who labour not for him who is in trouble; who are prompt to evil-speaking, who know not him that made them; murderers of children, corruptors of the image of Elohim; who turn away from the poor man and oppress the afflicted; advocates of the rich, unjust judges of the poor, sinners in all

sinaiticus.text: It is therefore right that he who has learned the ordinances of Yahweh, even as many as have been written beforehand, should walk in them. For he who does these things shall be glorified in the kingdom of Elohim, but he who chooses the contrary things shall perish together with his works. On this account is the resurrection; on this account is the retribution.

verses.text: It is therefore right that he who has learned the ordinances of Yahweh, even as many as have been written beforehand, should walk in them. For he who does these things shall be glorified in the kingdom of Elohim, but he who chooses the contrary things shall perish together with his works. On this account is the resurrection; on this account is the retribution.

sinaiticus.text: I ask those who are of high estate among you, if you will receive any friendly advice from me, keep those with you toward whom you may do what is honorable. Fail not in so doing.

verses.text: I ask those who are of high estate among you, if you will receive any friendly advice from me, keep those with you toward whom you may do what is honorable. Fail not in so doing.

sinaiticus.text: The day is at hand in which everything shall perish together with the evil one; Yahweh is nigh at hand, and his reward also.

verses.text: The day is at hand in which everything shall perish together with the evil one; Yahweh is nigh at hand, and his reward also.

sinaiticus.text: Again and again do I ask you, be you good Torah-givers over yourselves, be you good advisers of yourselves. Abide faithful counsellors of one another; take out of the midst of you all hypocrisy,

verses.text: Again and again do I ask you, be you good Torah-givers over yourselves, be you good advisers of yourselves. Abide faithful counsellors of one another; take out of the midst of you all hypocrisy,

sinaiticus.text: And may Elohim, who rules the whole world, give you wisdom, understanding, science, knowledge of his ordinances, and patience.

verses.text: And may Elohim, who rules the whole world, give you wisdom, understanding, science, knowledge of his ordinances, and patience.

sinaiticus.text: And be you taught of Elohim, inquiring what Yahweh seeks of you, and so work that you may be found saved in the Day of Judgment.

verses.text: And be you taught of Elohim, inquiring what Yahweh seeks of you, and so work that you may be found saved in the Day of Judgment.

sinaiticus.text: But if there is any memory of that which is good, remember me while you practice these things, that both your desire and your watching may turn unto some good.

verses.text: But if there is any memory of that which is good, remember me while you practice these things, that both your desire and your watching may turn unto some good.

sinaiticus.text: I beseech you this, asking it as a favor. So long as the good vessel is with you, fail not in any of these things, but seek them out without ceasing, and fulfill all the commandments, for these things are worthy.

verses.text: I beseech you this, asking it as a favor. So long as the good vessel is with you, fail not in any of these things, but seek them out without ceasing, and fulfill all the commandments, for these things are worthy.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore I have been the more anxious to write unto you, so far as I was able, to the end that I might make you glad. Farewell, children of love and peace; the Elohim of glory and of all grace be with your spirit. Amen.488

verses.text: Therefore I have been the more anxious to write unto you, so far as I was able, to the end that I might make you glad. Farewell, children of love and peace; the Elohim of glory and of all grace be with your spirit. Amen.488
